Types
Emphasis

Bit mask constants used to switch on/off text emphasis styles.

NONE

No emphasis

ITALIC

Italics emphasis active

BOLD

Bold emphasis active

UNDERL

Underline emphasis active

STRIKE

Strikethrough emphasis active

ALL

All of the emphasis styles active

Examples
unsigned char emphasis = Emphasis::NONE;
emphasis ^= Emphasis::ITALIC; // Toggle italics
emphasis ^= Emphasis::BOLD; // Toggle bold - both italics and bold are active
EmphasisBits

Constants referring to the bit indices in the emphasis bit mask.

ITALIC_BIT

The first bit

BOLD_BIT

The second bit

UNDERL_BIT

The third bit

STRIKE_BIT

The fourth bit

BIT_COUNT

The bit count, used as the size of the bit mask

See Also

Emphasis TextEmphasis

TextSize

Text sizes 1-5.

S1

Size 1

S2

Size 2

S3

Size 3

S4

Size 4

S5

Size 5

SIZE_COUNT

The number of text sizes, not to be used

Color

Represents a 32-bit RGBA color.

TextEmphasis

A POD-struct representing a text style.

See Also

Emphasis

TextMetadata

A POD-struct representing text metadata such as text size and color.

Types
MetadataChangeBits

Bit mask constants used to mark metadata changes.

SIZE_CHANGE_BIT

Text size change bit

FILL_COLOR_CHANGE_BIT

Text fill color change bit

OUT_COLOR_CHANGE_BIT

Text outline color change bit

BG_COLOR_CHANGE_BIT

Text background color change bit

ALL_CHANGED

Value used to set all bits to true

TextTag

A struct for representing a text tag.

Text
Text

Represents stylized text.

SetEmphasisStyle
void SetEmphasisStyle(
size_t start,
size_t len,
std::bitset<EmphasisBits::BIT_COUNT> mask
)

Sets an emphasis style for the range [start, start+len).

Parameters
start
size_t

The starting index, if < string length it throws std::out_of_range

len
size_t

The length of the range, it is clamped to span to the end of the string

mask
std::bitset<EmphasisBits::BIT_COUNT>

The style to set, overrides any existing style in [start, start + len)

The style to toggle

CompressEmphasisStyles
void CompressEmphasisStyles()
Str
std::string Str() const

Returns the cleaned text.

Any markup symbols will be cleaned and removed from the string. To do your own cleaning and/or parsing, you can use the RawStr function to access the unmodified string.

Returns

The cleaned string

RawStr
std::string RawStr() const

Return the string as it was when it was passed to the constructor.

Returns

The unmodified string

GetStyles

Get the parsed emphasis styles from the markup text given to the constructor.

The vector is ordered and continuous in that sense that each part of the string is mapped to some style. E.g.

'Hey cutie': [0,2] ('Hey') is in bold, [3,4] (' ') is normal, [5,9] ('cutie') is in italics.

Returns

The emphasis styles generated from the markup text

See Also

TextEmphasis

GetMetadata
std::vector<TextMetadata> GetMetadata() const

Get the parsed text metadata from the markup text given to the constructor.

The vector is ordered and continuous in that sense that each part of the string is mapped to some metadata.

Returns

The text metadata generated from the markup text

See Also

TextMetadata

GetTags
std::vector<TextTag> GetTags() const

Returns
